com.hush.hee
Class KeyManagementServices

java.lang.Object
  com.hush.hee.KeyManagementServices
All Implemented Interfaces:
PgpConstants, java.io.Serializable
public class KeyManagementServices
extends java.lang.Object
implements PgpConstants, java.io.Serializable

This class provides an interface to the Hush Key Server Network. Note that "aliases" are, in general, RFC822 email addresses. However, they are extended to support UTF8 character encoding.

See Also:

getEncryptionKey

public Key getEncryptionKey(Key key)
Finds the most recent, non-revoked encryption key and returns it, or null if one is not found. It's a hack that ignores expiration times.
If you want to use a key for encryption that is revoked or no longer valid, select it manually, not using this method.
This goes only by the algorithm type, not by the usage convention signature packet which may or may not exist.
This will not return keys for experimental algorithms such as Elliptic Curve or X9.42.
This will not verify any signatures. Those have to be checked separately.

Returns:
the encryption key

getPrivateKeyring

public Keyring getPrivateKeyring(java.lang.String alias,
                                 byte[] passphrase)
                          throws KeyStoreException,
                                 java.io.IOException,
                                 UnrecoverableKeyException
Gets a clone of the internal private keyring that has all keys decrypted. This is a *clone*. Keys added to this keyring will not be added to the internal cached key record.

Throws:
KeyStoreException
java.io.IOException
UnrecoverableKeyException

public java.util.Hashtable getEncryptionObjects(java.lang.String[] aliasess)
                                         throws KeyStoreException,
                                                NoEncryptionMethodException,
                                                InvalidSignatureException,
                                                java.io.IOException
Returns the appropriate method of encryption for each alias, such as a KeyRecord or a GeneratedPassword. In the future, it may return a QuestionAndAnswer too.

encryption objects, such as KeyRecords or GeneratedPasswords.

retrievePrivateKeyRecord

public KeyRecord retrievePrivateKeyRecord(java.lang.String alias,
                                          byte[] passphrase)
                                   throws java.io.IOException,
                                          KeyStoreException,
                                          UnrecoverableKeyException
This will return the private key record for an alias.

If the key record is cached and the passphrase is null, the key record is returned. If a passphrase is given, though, it is checked to see if it matches the cached record.

This method will never return null.

Throws:
java.io.IOException
KeyStoreException
UnrecoverableKeyException

updateRandom

public void updateRandom(java.lang.Object[] input)
Used to feed all available data into the PRNG. Note that it's fine to feed private data such as passphrases, private keys, etc., because all this data will be unrecoverable.

Parameters:
input - an array of Objects to convert to bytes or strings and feed to the PRNG
